summary: This is an email chain from November 24, 2021, among personnel at the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York (SDNY) coordinating the final review and shipment of evidentiary productions for the Ghislaine Maxwell trial. The email discusses time-sensitive logistics for sending materials, including a password-protected document, to the defense via FedEx.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Referenced as the recipient of evidentiary productions being sent by the U.S. Attorney's Office, indicated by the initials 'GM' in the email.

events.title: Coordination of Trial Productions
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office personnel coordinate the final review and shipment of evidentiary productions, including Rule 16 and 3500 materials, to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team via FedEx.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York dated November 24, 2021.
It concerns the time-sensitive review and physical shipment (via FedEx) of evidentiary productions to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team for her ongoing trial.
The productions include Rule 16 discovery materials and 3500 materials (Jencks Act materials for testifying and non-testifying witnesses).
A password-protected PDF document related to Maxwell is attached to the email.
The correspondence highlights the logistical coordination within the prosecution team close to the trial date.
